intro: Hedyotis aimiriikensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or yellow flowers and slender, creeping stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
